definitions.definition: the action or fact of elevating or being elevated.
examples: her sudden elevation to the cabinet
synonyms: aggrandizement; Moreennoblement; informalstep up the ladder "his elevation to the directorship"

definitions.definition: augmentation of or increase in the amount or level of something.
(in a Christian Mass) the raising of the consecrated elements for adoration.
height above a given level, especially sea level.
examples: a network of microclimates created by sharp differences in elevation

definitions.definition: the angle of something with the horizontal, especially of a gun or of the direction of a celestial object.
the ability of a dancer to attain height in jumps.
a particular side of a building.
examples: a burglar alarm was prominently displayed on the front elevation

definitions.definition: a drawing or diagram, especially of a building, made by projection on a vertical plane.
